alert.note: Alert for Assumption (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:56PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF TERREBONNE, LAFOURCHE, SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL ASSUMPTION PARISHES THROUGH 230 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 11 miles southwest of Cocodrie, or 29 miles south of Houma, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Houma, Cut Off, Galliano, Larose, Lockport, Golden Meadow, Mathews, Gray, Chauvin, Dulac, Port Fourchon, Raceland, Montegut, Bayou Cane, Leeville, Cocodrie, Tambour Bay Buoy, Timbalier Bay Buoy, and Lumcon Center Buoy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
